Description: Small rough brown ware pottery bowl with flat base and slightly in-turned rim, made of coarse Nile silt clay with many white inclusions. Originally self-slipped and burnished broadly while moist. Interior surface is worn away.
Bibliographic references: Brunton & Caton-Thompson 1928 / The Badarian Civilisation and Predynastic Remains near Badari (9, pl. xvii.R16m)
Condition: fair (incomplete). One quarter of rim is missing; all surfaces badly worn and now coated with consolidant.
Acquisition name: Donated by: British School of Archaeology, Egypt
